name: Application accepted (notice of proceedings) (overseas respondent: email service)
body:
#Notice of proceedings 

Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

Your ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) has been checked by court staff and accepted. Your case reference number is: ((reference number)). 

Your ((partner)) needs to be notified of the ((isDivorce??divorce application))((isDissolution??application to end your civil partnership)) so they can respond. 

#What you need to do 
You need to 'serve' (send) the ((isDivorce??divorce papers))((isDissolution??papers to end your civil partnership)) to your ((partner)) because the address you provided for them is outside of England or Wales. They must receive papers by ((review deadline date)). 

1. The court has sent you a separate email for you to send to your ((partner)). It's called 'Notice of Proceedings'. 
2. Forward the other 'Notice of Proceedings' email onto your ((partner)). They must receive it by ((review deadline date)). 
3. Keep a record of the email you have sent, to show that you have 'served' (sent) them the court documents.

#If they do not respond 
If your ((partner)) does not respond then you may have to prove they have been 'served' (sent) the ((isDivorce??divorce papers))((isDissolution??papers to end your civil partnership)). Each country has different rules for how you prove 'service'. You may need legal advice, to tell you how you prove that you have served the documents in that country.

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email.
